item.description:
This show will be by one of our members who, unfortunately for us, moved away from the area so he hasn't been able to hike with us.  We will get to share in some of his adventures when he returns to the area for this exciting slideshow.

=====

The Wind River Range is a remote mountain range running along the crest of the Continental Divide in western Wyoming . This climbers' and backpackers' paradise contains dozens of summits over 13,000 feet, many of the largest glaciers in the Rockies, and hundreds of shimmering alpine lakes nestling amid boulder strewn meadows.

At 13,800 foot high Gannett Peak, it is the highest summit in the Winds as well as the high-point of the state of Wyoming - it is also the more remote state high-point in the United States. This summer, Gokul Gopal spent a week in the Winds, with the primary objective of climbing Gannett Peak, but also hoping to experience more of what the Winds have to offer: spectacular backpacking and rock climbing opportunities far from tourist throngs.

In this hour-long slideshow Gokul will share some of his pictures and memories from this trip, along with some useful background information about the Wind River Range.

Doors open @ 6:15 PM - potluck @ 6:30 PM then show @ 7:15 PM

If you have any questions, please contact Julie at AMCBostonSlideshows@gmail.com.

For those who wish to participate in the potluck at 6:30pm, feel free to use the following guidelines: Last names beginning with A-J bring a main dish, K-S bring an appetizer or side dish, and T-Z bring a dessert or drink.

Homemade dishes are welcome, store bought goodies & takeout are equally welcome:) Plates, bowls, cups, cutlery, napkins and drink pitchers will be supplied. The AMC Auditorium has a kitchen if you need to do any re-warming or prep (stovetop, oven, microwave, sink, fridge, etc). Please bring your own cooking pots for rewarming dishes on the stovetop.

In the event of a schedule change or cancellation, an email will be sent out to those who RSVP.

Subway Directions: Take the Red Line T to Park Street Station. Walk through the Boston Common uphill towards the State House & Beacon Street. Continue up Joy St, which runs along the left side of the State House. The Auditorium is #4 Joy Street (just before the AMC Headquarters Building, on the left side).
item.name: Wind River Range - Backpacking & Climbing (Potluck & Slideshow)
